text.section: In this section, "animal control unit" means the local organization or governmental unit that the appropriate local governmental body designates to house, care for, and control domestic animals of unknown ownership.

An animal control unit shall dispose of an unclaimed dog or cat only by:
placing the animal in a suitable home;
retaining the animal in the animal control unit; or
humanely destroying the animal.

section.section: An owner who retrieves an animal from an animal control unit shall pay all fees, costs, and expenses incurred by the animal control unit.

The necessary expenses for food and attention given to an animal under this section may be collected from the owner, and the animal is not exempt from levy and sale on execution of a judgment for the expenses.
A new owner with whom an animal is placed under subsection (b)(1) of this section may be charged an adoption fee.

text.section: A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $500.
